alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 12:55PM EDT until March 26 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EDT Friday was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 05/28/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Rifle River Sterling 6.0 7.3 Fri 12 pm ED 5.5 4.6 4.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued with any updated river stage forecasts.
